Legal_Issue: Procedural fairness in refugee appeal proceedings
Outcome: Judicial review partially allowed; section 97 claim remitted for reconsideration, section 96 claim dismissed
Procedural_Context: Appeal from Refugee Protection Division (RPD) decision
Credibility_Assessment: RAD reviewed positive credibility findings not challenged by the applicant
Evidence_Type: Credibility evidence, delay in claiming protection
Application_Error: RAD reviewed unchallenged credibility findings without affording procedural opportunity
Review_Outcome: Remanded for reconsideration on section 97 claim
Application_Factor: Opportunity to respond to new issues on appeal
Decision_Outcome: Section 96 claim dismissed, section 97 claim remitted
Decision_Review_Issue: Breach of procedural fairness by RAD
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Principle of procedural fairness, IRPA s. 101(1)(a)
Evidentiary_Issues: New credibility concerns raised without notice
Procedural_Fairness: Breach found: applicant not given chance to respond to new credibility issues
Credibility_Issues: Unchallenged positive credibility findings revisited by RAD
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Procedural unfairness in RAD's decision-making process
Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide opportunity to respond
Omission_Type: Failure to afford right to respond
